Wilkinson, The Complete Temples of Ancient Egypt (London, 2000), and Salima Ikram and Aidan Dodson, The Mummy in Ancient Egypt: Equipping the Dead for Eternity (London, 1998) cover those aspects of Egyptian religion where buildings and archaeology make extensive contributions. Again, however, there is no substitute for approaching the texts themselves. title: combines a full translation of the most popular ancient text with fine colored photographs of one particular example. Our knowledge of the more pragmatic aspects of ancient Egyptian life and knowledge comes from combining sources of all kinds, including scenes drawn from life that were carved and painted on the walls of Egyptian tombs.
